TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {25553=The Government needs to look into the gender health gap.  What is more important money or health, I think most would agree health. Mens health issues are very underfunded compared to womens.  This is despite higher rates or cancer, heart disease, lower life expentancy and higher sucide rates amoung males. The government had a womens longitudinal health study since 1995 but none for men, why? We must have gender equity in health research and funding.}
textBeforeTable: Courier Mail Blogs – Talk to your journalists close  x thanks http://blogs.news.com.au/couriermail/moneystuff/index.php/couriermail/comments/why_is/ The full post with comments is available at: Yesterday’s decision by Fair Work Australia on the Equal Remuneration Case was in every way historic. Community services â the area of industry covered by the decision â are undoubtably underfunded. And most probably undervalued by the members of the public who have no need to access the services (which realistically is many of us). The really interesting thing about the decision of course was the finding by the panel that the industry is not simply underfunded due to public apathy or government stinginess, but also partly due to the gender makeup of the workforce. That is, that a significant reason for the paltry salaries in the industry is because most of the workforce is female. Gender inequality.
